name: Macdonald Elmers Court Hotel & Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a short stay at Elmers Court hotel where we had booked a couple of nights in a standard double room with breakfast. We were delighted with our experience.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our standard ensuite room was clean and comfortable, providing an iron and ironing board, trouser press, hairdryer, tea and coffee facilities, TV, 2 comfortable chairs and a desk and a very comfortable bed. We were also delighted to have a veranda outside our room which overlooked the garden and main building. We used our own camp chairs and enjoyed what was quite a sun-trap.
reviews.title: Quiet, clean and peaceful, just a couple of little niggles

reviews.text: The hotel grounds are beautiful and overlook the estaury, with views across the river and boats moored at Lymington. We visited the leisure centre on site, which was excellent. The outdoor pool, which is heated, was not yet available for residents' use but looks amazing. The area is beautiful.
reviews.title: Where does everyone go at night ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were courteous and friendly and the breakfasts were excellent.
reviews.title: Would recommend it.

reviews.text: Our only negative comments would be that we were able to hear someone on the phone in the next room to ours so maybe the soundproofing between rooms could be better, but then the person seemed to be talking very loudly. Also, we were not very impressed with the menu at Sails restaurant (price and quality of the food served).
reviews.title: Dont be deceived by looks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on lastminute.com. We paid £45 for one night and thought this was great value. The swimming pool, jacuzzi, steam room and sauna were all fantastic to relax in after a day cycling through the forest! The room was cosy and clean with all the basics you need. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We didn't eat in the restuarant so can't comment on that. We would highly recommend the market in Lymington on Saturday morning. The gardens that the hotel is set in are really pretty and worth a walk around too.
reviews.title: What a bargain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After booking this hotel we read some of the reviews on here and were not sure what to expect but can honestly say that we would definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends and family. At the end of the day it is a 3 star hotel so you won't get a 5 star stay but it was very suitable for our needs.
reviews.title: Dated and basic, but comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: We stayed in a Suite for 3 nights, and were self catering so can't comment on the restaurant. The room was in the courtyard and not in the main house (as expected), and was very comfortable although had a distinct 1990's feel to it in terms of decor - could do with an update! It was very quiet here, although that may be different when it's busier. The kitchen area was well equipped (washing machine, dishwasher, oven, fridge, crockery, cutlery, utensils etc) - although take a chopping board, scissors and a decent knife as these weren't available. We had to get a couple of wine glasses from the Sails bar too, although they were happy to let us borrow them.
reviews.title: Real value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was very good - a nice warm and large pool with a small jacuzzi in the corner. One down side is that this is used by non-residents so gets very busy. And as we found out, is used for swimming lessons - hardly the relaxing swim we had in mind!!
reviews.title: Not what was expected, should do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a great base for exploring the New Forest, and is in easy reach of Lymington (half hour walk, 5 minute drive, taxi £5). Attractions at Beaulieu, Brockenhurst, Lyndhurst, Miford on Sea and the Isle of Wight Ferry were all easy to get to.
reviews.title: Looking for relaxation then forget it!

reviews.text: My daughter and I have just returned from two nights B&B at Elmers Court. We had fantastic weather and a really great time. Apart from a blip in service on Sunday morning at breakfast - tables were not cleared and laid up which entailed three different parties having to wait for some time and even then staff were not addressing the problem with any apparent urgency - it was a really enjoyable stay. Monday morning breakfast was a totally different experience so it seemed there had been a staffing issue on our first morning. All members of staff we encountered were extremely courteous and pleasant, check in and out was very efficient, and all in all everyone was extremely helpful. The outdoor pool was warm enough and very clean.
reviews.title: Great weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each evening we took the two minute train ride from Lymington Pier, just a few minutes walk from the hotel, into Lymington itself which saved a 25/30 minute walk each way. One drawback was that the last train left the town at 22.07 but the Sails bar was still open and we were able to enjoy a late night drink there. We would recommend The Ship Inn on the Quay for food and drink and take out fish and chips from the High Street. The New Forest Open top bus tour was also well worth doing - £9 each. We stopped off in Beaulieu and walked from there to Bucklers Hard and back (allow a couple of hours) or there is the motor museum or Exbury Gardens, neither of which we had time to do. Tea at The Thatched Cottage in Brockenhurst was also very much appreciated. All in all a great weekend and a hotel we would return to.
reviews.title: Good hotel- great restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our recent 5-night DBB stay at Macdonald’s Elmers Court. Our room, an ‘Executive Zip’, was clean, comfortable, and well appointed, with a useful fridge and sink area. The grounds are attractive, well maintained, and obviously enjoyed by guests of all ages. The food on offer in the Waterford restaurant was excellent, particularly for a hotel. The restaurant manager and her staff are pleasant without being intrusive and are well informed about their food and wine. We took breakfast in our room each day which was fine once we had discovered the secret of getting our order card reliably into the system; hand it in to reception. My wife received a manicure and massage in the spa finding the staff skilled and helpful. However, the treatment area is rather dismal with no natural light and is not easily accessible for clients with mobility difficulties, being located at the bottom of a substantial flight of stairs. Parking for hotel guests was just about adequate as a large number of spaces are reserved for other users of the site. We could only see two dedicated spaces for ‘blue badge’ drivers. Would the hotel manager consider converting his reserved parking space next to the main entrance into a blue badge space?
reviews.title: Good value for money - would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At checkout we identified that a charge of over one hundred pounds had been mistakenly added to our bill. The receptionist did apologise and corrected the error after we pointed it out. As in any hotel, remember what you sign for and check your bill.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will stay at Elmers Court again and certainly recommend it.
reviews.title: Couldn't find fault if I tried!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed just one night at the Elmers Court Hotel - a last minute getaway via laterooms. If you decide to stay here it's unlikely you will be in the main house, they have a number of lodge style rooms - I haven't been to Centre Parks but they look similar. The rooms are quite spacious, clean and tidy, they have large patio doors onto balconies or paths which doesn't allow for any privacy at all. The pool/sauna etc was ok, a bit dated but great for an hour's chill out.
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant in the main house, which is about to be refurbished. The food was fabulous and the service excellent. £25 for 3 courses + coffee, which we felt was a good price for the standard.
reviews.title: Unsure Whether it's an Improvement

likes.liked: — Studio turned out to better than anticipated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great last minute getaway at £45 for the room.
reviews.title: Nice country hotel
A Few Issues with Facilities
reviews.text: Wife and self have stayed at this resort four times as timeshare exchangees. The last occasion some 3 years ago we needed to have the cleaners called to clean the unit, after they had already done so, to spray the rooms to be rid of cigar stink, clean windows and provide chair-backs to cover hair grease on arm chairs. This time there was none of this for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky this time, over New Year, to have been put in the Hobien?? block in what was earlier described as a studio but turned out to be more like a one-b/room unit. Very good once one had made acceptable furniture rearrangements and placed the kitchen garbage container in the bathroom as there was no floor space in the kitchen.
reviews.title: Not too bad but pricey

aka: Macdonald Elmers Court Hotel And Resort
description: Located on the stunning Solent Coast, this New Forest hotel is only 15 minutes' walk from the nearby town of Lymington. Set in a manor house dating from 1820 and surrounded by 23 acres of private grounds, the Macdonald Elmers Court Hotel & Resort is the ideal venue for a weekend break or a romantic wedding in the Hampshire countryside. Swim in the indoor or seasonal outdoor pool, book in for a spa treatment, dine in the elegant Waterford Restaurant or simply relax in the spacious accommodation.
